course.title: The Tapestry Framework

programs.program: Graduate in Complementary Studies in Applied Informatics: Java Development for the Enterprise

course.tagline: Creating full-featured web apps by connecting framework components to economical amounts of application code.
course.description: Many web development frustrations can be traced back to the underlying stateless HTTP protocol. Tapestry represents state and behavior as standard Java objects, methods and properties. That means state management and multithreading are handled by the framework, leaving you with just your application's business logic. Tapestry does more, you do less. Many simple examples show you how to tackle common tasks such as form validation, application localization, client-side scripting, and synchronization between browser and app server. More advanced topics including creation of new components and integration with J2EE are also discussed.
